text:
welcome to hot thai kitchen so today i have a 
really simple but so delicious vegetable side

dish that's perfect for the holiday table but 
really any time of year because it's so easy and

delicious and i feel like this dish is sort of a 
food representation of me because it's like this

yummy mash-up of thai and canadian ingredients 
it just it's so good it's brussels sprouts

pan roasted with fish sauce and maple syrup i mean 
you can almost make it with that much information

it's so simple so let's get started so i'm using a 
pound of brussels sprouts here and that weight is

after trimming because everybody trims slightly 
different amounts so make sure you buy just a

little bit more than a pound and you want to make 
sure these are dry so you want to wash them before

you cut them because if you got too much 
moisture lodged into these the brussels

sprouts will steam and they'll become soft rather 
than al dente which is kind of what i'm going for

and just trim the bottom get rid of any sort of 
yucky loose leaves on the edge okay that's all

that and then the rest of the stuff i got some 
good old canadian maple syrup but maple syrup

brussels sprouts at least in canada anyway it's a 
pretty popular combination that's where i got the

idea but you can just try honey or golden syrup 
or maybe even palm sugar you can do that and then

i got fish sauce if you've got good quality 
fish sauce now is the time to break that out

and as an option this is not required at all i 
have made some fried garlic okay so i've made

fried garlic many times on the show before but 
basically all you do is you fry garlic in oil

on low heat until it's golden and crispy 
you want to strain the garlic away from

the oil keep them both because i want to 
use the oil when i fry the brussels sprouts

for a shortcut you can just sprinkle some garlic 
powder at the end as well or just skip the garlic

all together i've done it without the garlic and 
it's still good but this is like the extra step

and then just a little bit of white pepper you 
can do black pepper if you like and that's it

let's get cooking so we're going to do this stove 
top which i love because for the holidays your

oven's probably busy with other things anyway so 
i love this technique and it's so fast so i've

got a large flat skillet here which you want 
the biggest one you you have so they have lots

of room but you still want to do this in two 
batches because it'll probably be a little too

crowded so i'm going to add my oh oil first so if 
you did fry fry your garlic you want to use the

garlic frying oil for this for extra flavor but if 
you didn't regular oil will be fine and i want to

add more because i want the pan to be thoroughly 
covered in oil and that's how you're going to get

nice browning on the brussels sprouts i never 
said this was low calories heat's still off

because i want to give myself lots of time to 
go in and put them cut side down look at that

it's like they're all revolting against me like i 
randomly pop them in and they all decide to turn

the wrong way you can fill the pan completely 
as long as all of them are making nice contact

that's good now it's all going in there i'm going 
to turn my heat on and just medium high and you're

waiting now just waiting do not touch them do 
not stir them waiting until they get nice and

well browned on the bottom side that's the key to 
delicious brussels sprouts not steamed but browned

if you have one of these might come 
in handy and check them regularly

i remember one of the restaurants i used 
to work at they deep fried their brussels

sprouts and it was the first time i'd ever seen 
brussels sprouts deep fried and it was like

what this is amazing and it was delicious so this 
is almost deep frying them you're getting the same

level of brownness without actually having to deep 
fry them okay well let's see where we're at oh the

ones around the edges are starting to brown a 
bit i can probably do with a little bit more

see this one is kind of what you're going 
for right here and it's funny that my stove

at home it's the middle that will brown faster 
but with this dough it will be the one on the

edges okay so once you know that all of them have 
brown what you can do is just give them a toss

so that you're not having to individually 
flip them and then you just go back and

get the ones that did not cooperate 
so once they're on the other side

it really only takes oh this is perfect browning 
right here it really only takes another one or

two minutes for this size if yours is a little bit 
bigger i would recommend cutting them in quarters

maybe so it doesn't take as long so what i'm 
going to do now i'm going to turn this off

remove them so i can do my second batch and 
i want to leave all the oil in the pan so i'm

going to use tongs oh the texture is perfect it's 
just tender enough but still firm in the middle

get rid of any stray bits and then we repeat with 
the other half i'm gonna add a little bit more oil

and so for this batch i'm going to add 
maybe a little bit less so i don't have too

much oil overall i'm really happy with 
the browning of the first batch already
okay see i just wanted to show let me turn this on

okay see i just wanted to show you what happens 
when you don't add as much oil see how like some

pieces just are not browning as evenly which 
is you know what if you're concerned about how

much oil it may not be the end of the world for 
you but i just wanted to show you the difference

man some of these are just like jumping and then 
it doesn't cook quite as evenly when there's not

as much oil but hey there you go i show you 
two different ways oh the rebel just like

no they're fine slightly over charred because 
we're running around doing that but you know

what that's what happens when you film without 
ventilation let me just taste it to see how

charred these are because brussels sprouts will 
surprisingly take charredness quite well you know

some vegetables get grilled that dark grilled 
mark and they're fine oh yeah it's wrong okay

okay so what you're going to do now is actually 
put them back in the pan the heat is off now

and then all our seasoning goes in and the pan is 
still a bit hot which is what we want so now the

fish sauce and the maple syrup and the reason 
why i don't add the fish sauce in the maple

syrup oh and the pepper in the beginning when the 
heat is on is the fish sauce will actually sort

of evaporate and burn to the pan and instead of 
coating your brussels sprouts it'll coat the pan

and because fish sauce is liquid it has the unlike 
salt it has the ability to just like seep into all

the nooks and crannies of the brussels sprouts 
so we can afford to season it after the fact and

still have it go all over all right let's plate 
it up and you know what this is a great thing also

to serve room temp so you can make it in advance 
it doesn't have to be hot to pee to be delicious

and i would plate it on something flat-ish just so 
the sauce doesn't all end up at the bottom of the

bowl and then this is fine but i got fried garlic 
or you can top it whatever bacon bits that would

be really good actually whatever crispy toppings 
you like and ta-da look at that tastefully charred

okay i'm going to taste it i 
want some crispy bits of garlic

pepper i can smell the pepper 
and the fish sauce of course

so good so simple yes so good this is the thing 
you've got the fish sauce which is salty and umami

and then the maple syrup which is sweet to 
balance the fish sauce and brussels sprouts

really benefit from something sweet and 
and it's got its own little maple flavor

which doesn't isn't obvious here but it 
really adds some complexity to the dish

and it doesn't stand out like if you have a 
traditional thanksgiving table for example

this doesn't stand out as something completely 
different in flavor so i think it still works

quite well with a traditional meal but it's 
just got a little something something different

and that is it i hope you give this a try it's 
so simple but make sure you turn on the hood fan

when you're cooking don't turn it up and shut all 
the windows like we do when we film these videos

it's not good the recipe as always will be on and 
send me a photo when you have made it on facebook

twitter or instagram and if you haven't subscribed 
to the show make sure you do so you don't miss

the recipe and click the bell icon as well so 
you get a notification when i post a new video

thank you as always for watching and i will see 
you next time for your next delicious thai meal
